Similarity approaches utilized in the biomedical domain can be roughly divided into knowledge based and distributional based methods [ 12 - 14 ] .Knowledge based methods utilize pre - existing knowledge sources , including dictionaries , taxonomies , and semantic networks .

Knowledge based approaches utilize knowledge sources such as dictionaries , taxonomies , and semantic networks , and include path finding measures and intrinsic information content ( IC ) measures .Distributional measures utilize , in addition to a knowledge source , the distribution of concepts within a corpus to compute similarity ; these include corpus IC and context vector methods .
